article_title: Epic Health Services buys longtime Houston medical company
article_text:
Epic Health Services buys longtime Houston medical company

Photo: Courtesy Of Epic Chris Roussos, CEO and president of Epic Health Services, a...

In its continued quest to get care to tens of thousands of the nation's sickest children, Dallas-based Epic Health Services has bought Houston's Medco, a local family-owned business that has provided of feeding tubes, respiratory equipment and incontinence products for more than four decades.

article_metadata.description: In its continued quest to get care to tens of thousands of the nation's sickest children, Dallas-based Epic Health Services has bought Houston's Medco, a local family-owned business that has provided of feeding tubes, respiratory equipment and incontinence products for more than four decades.  Last month Epic, a provider of skilled nursing services, therapy and autism care, acquired Option I Healthcare Solutions, an Arizona-based company with offices in Texas.  Medco was founded more than 40 years ago in a back room of a pharmacy and grew into a leading supplier of feeding tubes, nutritional formulas, incontinence products and respiratory equipment, a company website said.
article_metadata.author.name: By Jenny Deam
